row.entry: This parameter indicates a unique name for the bundle.
This parameter indicates the security domain associated with the bundle.
Select the required security domain from the predefined security domains in the drop-down list.
This parameter indicates the bundle purchase fee deducted only from the main account balance.
This parameter indicates the taxation profile to be applied.
Select the required taxation profile from the drop-down list that contains the taxation profiles you have already created.

entry.p: This parameter indicates the charging services associated with the bundle.
This parameter value can either be zero or more charging services.

row.entry: Select either zero or the IDs of one or more charging services.

entry.p: This parameter indicates the usage control services associated with the bundle.
This parameter value can either be zero or more usage control services.
This parameter indicates whether the bundle is a normal bundle or a Bundle On Use (BOU) type of bundle.
Following are the supported values for this parameter:

li.p: Normal: Indicates that the bundle is a normal bundle.
On Session: Indicates that it is a BOU type of bundle. Once you select this option, you must define at least a single rule with an activation event.

ul.li: Auto-Install: Indicates the auto-install type of bundle. Once you select this option, you must define at least a single rule with an activation event. See for more details.

entry.p: This parameter allows to add one or more Usage Control Services (UCSs) from the list of predefined UCS or remove the existing ones.
The usage measurement and control are configured in UCS.
For more information on UCS, see Policy User Guide Usage control service.
Select the required UCS from the predefined list of UCSs.
Note: You can add the same UCS to a bundle multiple times.

row.entry: This parameter indicates the object status lifecycle associated with the bundle.
Select the required lifecycle from the predefined lifecycle values in the drop-down list.
This parameter indicates the billing cycle associated with the bundle.
Select the required lifecycle from the predefined lifecycle values in the drop-down list.
This parameter indicates the maximum number of times a subscription can be renewed. If there is no value specified, then it denotes unlimited renewals can take place.

entry.p: This parameter indicates the hour of day to which the bundle is applicable.
Following are the supported values for this parameter

li.p: 0 to 23
Exact: If selected, the end date and time has the same time as subscription start time.

Start of new day: If selected, the end date and time is aligned to 00:00:00 of next day as per the lifecycle periodicity. For example, if a monthly subscription is purchased on 20th Jan 13:45:00, then the end date and time of subscription is set to 21st Feb 00:00:00.

entry.p: Note: Once the bundle is created, this attribute cannot be added or deleted, but it can be modified using the Update action.
This parameter indicates the day of month to which the bundle is applicable.
Following are the supported values for this parameter

li.p: 1 to 31
Exact: If selected, the day of month is aligned to subscription purchase date.

entry.p: Once the bundle is created, this attribute cannot be added or deleted, but it can be modified using the Update action.
Integer
Value range: 01 to 31
This parameter indicates the day of the week to which the bundle is applicable.
Following are the supported values for this parameter

li.p: Sunday to Saturday
Exact: If selected, the day of week is aligned to subscription purchase date.

entry.p: Once the bundle is created, this attribute is set to default value when no input is provided in Update action.

row.entry:
If this field is true, then Day of Week, or Hour of Day, or Day of Month can either be Null or Exact. Supported values are True, False. Default value is False.
The subscription BCR time is calculated based on billing information in the bundle definition or in linked account lifecycle periodicity. When a bundle is subcribed, a new subscription is created and aligned to same BCR. You can modify this behavior to change the alignment of the bundle instance's BCR time by using the input date provided by operator's provisioning system during bundle subscription. If the Align with Input Date parameter is True, then the subscription's BCR calculation ignores the billing information and aligns as per the input date. This behavior is applicable for both normal and BOU bundles.See for examples.

entry.p: This field indicates a reference of another bundle. When a new bundle is subscribed, the reference bundle must be attached and must not be in barred state. If a reference bundle is not present in Device or Group, or if present but in barred state, then the new bundle is not subscribed.
If a new subscription is created with future activation and if future activation time is greater than or equal to reference bundle expiry time, then the new bundle is not subscribed.
If a reference bundle is not in barred state, then the new bundle is aligned with reference bundle's end date and time.
If a reference bundle has more than one subscriptions attached with Device/Group and those are not barred, then the new bundle is aligned with reference bundle subscription with least expiry time.
Supported values are null, bundle name. The default value is null. If an empty string is provided in the provisioning request, it is internally treated as default value of null.
See for more details.

If this flag is set to True, then TTC calculation is not done and VT is aligned to subscription's expiry date and time. If MIN_VT is set in Slicing profile entity, it will act as a limit that cannot be crossed for Validity Time.

When both aligned bundle and reference bundle are present and reservation is done from aligned bundle, then Disable TTC flag of aligned bundle is ignored and flag of reference bundle is always used. See for more details.
Supported values are true, false. The default value is false. If null is provided in the provisioning request, it is internally treated as default value of false.

row.entry: This field indicates how to apply prorating the bundle fee defined in the Bundle fee / Overridden bundle fee parameter mentioned in the Subscription API.

entry.p: Following are the supported values for this parameter:

li.p: NONE: Indicates no prorating fee for the bundle.

SUBSCRIPTION: Indicates that bundle fee is prorated based on the exact available day of the current billing cycle, which means whenever a device purchases a subscription, the fee for the bundle is prorated.

REMOVAL: Indicates that bundle fee is refunded based on the days left in the billing cycle, which means whenever a device removes the subscription or unsubscribes or subscription ends, then refund the amount back to the device.
BOTH: Indicates that bundle fee is prorated when the subscription is taken or removed.

row.entry:
This parameter gets enabled when the Bundle fee / Overridden bundle fee parameter is set to a value other than None.
Select one of the following values from the drop-down list:
Bundle fee / Overridden fee: Select this option when fee defined in the Bundle fee / Overridden bundle fee parameter must be considered as the bundle initial charge or activation fee.
In other words, this value specifies whether prorating must be done on bundle or overridden fee. The overridden fee has a higher priority than bundle fee. If an overridden fee is specified in a bundle, then it is prorated. Otherwise, the bundle fee is prorated.
Charge fee action:
If initial charge or activation fee for bundle is configured to be deducted using the Charge Fee action, then it should be defined in the Initial state of periodic lifecycle of subscription, which means the bundle fee is charged as is and the charge fee action in the subscription initial state is prorated.
If initial charge or activation fee for bundle is configured to be deducted using the Charge Fee action for subscriptions to be activated in a future date, then it can be defined in any state of periodic lifecycle of subscription, where activation date is provided while creation of the subscription and the charge fee gets prorated (as applicable).

entry.p: This parameter indicates how to apply prorating for the buckets of the bundle.
Select one of the following values from the drop-down list:

li.p: None: Indicates that bucket value is not prorated, which means the initial value given in the bundle is not prorated and the entire amount is given.
Subscription Start: Indicates that bucket value is prorated based on the exact available day of the current billing cycle.

entry.p: This parameter indicates how to apply prorating for the counter of the bundle.
Select one of the following values from the drop-down list:

li.p: None: Indicates that counter value is not prorated.
Subscription Start: Indicates that counter value is prorated after checking the counter prorating cap value according to the exact available day of current billing cycle of counter cap value.

row.entry: Bundle fee on billing cycle date update

This parameter indicates whether to execute bundle fee prorating and bucket or counter value prorating when updating balance billing date manually.
Select one of the following values from the drop-down list:
None: Indicates that prorating is not done.
Prorate: Indicates that prorating is done as per other controlling parameters in the bundle definition.
For example, if the account billing cycle is modified, then other prorating parameters, such as Bucket Prorate Mode or Counter Prorate Mode is checked. If the Counter Prorate Mode is set as None, then NCC prorates the bundle fee and bucket value.
Force Prorate: Indicates that prorating is done without considering the values of controlling parameters in the bundle definition.
For example, when the account billing information is modified, NCC does not look for other prorating parameters, such as Bucket Prorate Mode or Counter Prorate Mode. By default, NCC prorates the resources as well as the fee that is configured already.

entry.p: This field provides flexibility to round-off the prorate fee and other values to days and hours.
Select one of the following values from the drop-down list:

li.p: Default: Current time is considered as the Bundle Applicable Time.
Hours: Rounded to current hour of the day. For example, if current time is 6 March 2020 17:45:45:237 and prorate granularity is Hour, then the Bundle Applicable Time is 6 March 2020 17:00:00:000.

Days: Rounded to current day start time or if lifecycle is account and “hour of the day” is present in billing information then the Bundle Applicable Time is rounded to that “hour of the day” time of current or previous day. For example, consider a subscription does not have its own periodic lifecycle and account has a periodic lifecycle with timer Units set as Month and timer Value set as 1. Suppose the current time is 6 March 2020 17:45:45:000 and billing information with hourOfDay set as 5:
End time is 18 March 2020 5:00:00:000 and Prorate Granularity is Days, then the Bundle Applicable Time is 6 March 2020 05:00:00:000.
